## PackageJson.PackageJsonStandard interface

Type for \[npm's `package.json` file\](https://docs.npmjs.com/creating-a-package-json-file). Containing standard npm properties.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export interface PackageJsonStandard 
```

|  [preferGlobal?](./types.packagejson.packagejsonstandard.preferglobal.md) |  | boolean | _(Optional)_ If set to <code>true</code>, a warning will be shown if package is installed locally. Useful if the package is primarily a command-line application that should be installed globally. |
|  [private?](./types.packagejson.packagejsonstandard.private.md) |  | boolean | _(Optional)_ If set to <code>true</code>, then npm will refuse to publish it. |
|  [publishConfig?](./types.packagejson.packagejsonstandard.publishconfig.md) |  | [PublishConfig](./types.packagejson.publishconfig.md) | _(Optional)_ A set of config values that will be used at publish-time. It's especially handy to set the tag, registry or access, to ensure that a given package is not tagged with 'latest', published to the global public registry or that a scoped module is private by default. |
|  [repository?](./types.packagejson.packagejsonstandard.repository.md) |  | \| string \| { type: string; url: string; directory?: string; } | _(Optional)_ Location for the code repository. |
|  [scripts?](./types.packagejson.packagejsonstandard.scripts.md) |  | [Scripts](./types.packagejson.scripts.md) | _(Optional)_ Script commands that are run at various times in the lifecycle of the package. The key is the lifecycle event, and the value is the command to run at that point. |
|  [type?](./types.packagejson.packagejsonstandard.type.md) |  | 'module' \| 'commonjs' | <p>_(Optional)_ Resolution algorithm for importing ".js" files from the package's scope.</p><p>\[Read more.\](https://nodejs.org/api/esm.html\#esm\_package\_json\_type\_field)</p> |
|  [version?](./types.packagejson.packagejsonstandard.version.md) |  | string | _(Optional)_ Package version, parseable by \[<code>node-semver</code>\](https://github.com/npm/node-semver). |
